Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
logic.gamesystem.GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Central game state and progression manager.

GameLogic is a singleton that stores the current player, the active enemy, stage progression, and game/ stage end flags. It is responsible for:

  • Spawning enemies appropriate for the current stage
  • Advancing stages and handling stage-clear logic
  • Providing reward information after miniboss encounters
  • Applying reward cards and equipping gear (via simple setters)

This class intentionally contains concrete stage→enemy mappings (the spawnEnemyForStage(int) method). If stage composition must be data-driven in the future, consider extracting the mapping to a configuration structure or factory.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class
    Description
    static class 
    GameLogic.RewardInfo
    Simple value object describing reward composition presented to the player after special encounters (typically minibosses).

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameLogic getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of GameLogic.
      Returns:
      the shared GameLogic instance

    • onStageCleared

      public void onStageCleared()
      Should be called when a stage is cleared.

      If the stage-end flag is set and the current stage is less than maxStage, advances to the next stage, clears the stage-end flag, and spawns the next stage's enemy. If the current stage already equals maxStage, the game is flagged as ended.

    • onEnemyDeath

      public void onEnemyDeath()
      Notifies the game logic that the current enemy has died. This sets the internal stage-end flag; further handling is performed by onStageCleared().

    • getCurrentRewardInfo

      public GameLogic.RewardInfo getCurrentRewardInfo()
      Returns the reward information that should be offered now based on miniboss progression maintained by GameController.getMiniBossClearCount().

      Current mapping:

      • 1 → 5 cards, rarity 2, SWORD
      • 2 → 2 cards, rarity 3, HELMET
      • 3 → 1 card, rarity 4, SUIT
      • default → 0 cards, rarity 1, NONE
      Returns:
      a GameLogic.RewardInfo describing the next reward to present

    • addRewardCards

      public void addRewardCards(int rarity, int atkCount, int magCount, int healCount, int specCount)
      Adds reward cards to the global deck pool.

      This method creates the requested number of each card type at the given rarity and adds them to GameController.getDeckPool().

      Parameters:
      rarity - rarity code for the added cards
      atkCount - number of Attack cards to add
      magCount - number of Magic cards to add
      healCount - number of Heal cards to add
      specCount - number of Special_Effect cards to add

    • equipRewardGear

      public void equipRewardGear(GearSlot slot, int type)
      Equips reward gear on the current player.

      The method currently supports simple integer gear types (1 or 2). If slot is GearSlot.NONE or type is not 1 or 2, the call is ignored. The implementation assigns the type directly via Player setters.

      Parameters:
      slot - gear slot to equip
      type - gear type code (expected 1 or 2)

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game state to the starting configuration:
      • Clears game/stage end flags
      • Sets current stage to 1 and spawns its enemy
      • Creates a fresh Player instance

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(Player player)
      Replaces the current player instance.
      Parameters:
      player - new player object

    • setEnemy

      public void setEnemy(Enemy enemy)
      Replaces the current enemy instance.
      Parameters:
      enemy - new enemy object

    • setGameEnd

      public void setGameEnd(Boolean gameEnd)
      Sets the game-ended flag. External callers (for example, enemy code) should set this flag when a terminal condition occurs.
      Parameters:
      gameEnd - true if the game should be considered ended

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns the current player instance.
      Returns:
      current Player

    • getEnemy

      public Enemy getEnemy()
      Returns the current enemy instance.
      Returns:
      current Enemy

    • getGameEnd

      public Boolean getGameEnd()
      Returns whether the game is flagged as ended.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended; otherwise false

    • getStageEnd

      public Boolean getStageEnd()
      Returns whether the current stage is marked as ended.
      Returns:
      true if the stage is ended; otherwise false

    • setStageEnd

      public void setStageEnd(Boolean stageEnd)
      Sets the stage-ended flag.
      Parameters:
      stageEnd - new value for the stage-end flag

    • setCurrentStage

      public void setCurrentStage(int currentStage)
      Sets the current stage number.
      Parameters:
      currentStage - stage number to set

    • getMaxStage

      public int getMaxStage()
      Returns the configured maximum stage value for the game.
      Returns:
      maximum stage number

    • getCurrentStage

      public int getCurrentStage()
      Returns the current stage number.
      Returns:
      current stage

    • isFinalStage

      public boolean isFinalStage()
      Returns whether the current stage is the final stage (or beyond).
      Returns:
      true when currentStage >= maxStage
